intro: Tragacantha gaillardotii, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its compact, globular growth habit and produces showy, yellow to orange flowers during the spring and early summer. The plant has small, narrow leaves and is well adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. It is often found in rocky soils and can thrive with minimal water, making it a hardy species for xeriscaping. The plant's unique morphology and resilience make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
